intro: Dicliptera zeylanica var. neesii, commonly known as the narrow-leaved kyllinga, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered spikes of pale green to brown flowers, which are typically wind-pollinated. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
